page.title: 18Housing in Swanley Village
page.content: Swanley Village is 1 1/2 miles from Swanley Town.Most houses are pre-victorian but all housing types can be found.The most interesting is the old college,parts were built in the 13th Century.We were allowed to go inside,there is a gallery all around like a balcony,and part of the roof structure is supposed to be 600yrs old. There is a big open fire-place and the gentleman showed us a piece of wattle and daub.It is made out of sticks, manure and dried mud.There was a trap door leading to the cellar,with 15 steps going down.The ideal temperature for a cellar is 60deg F and ideal to store food. It was a very interesting house and well looked after.It seemed strange to be looking at a house in 1985 that was built nearly 600yrs ago.
